   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_6&action=watch]

Armed conflicts and attacks

 * Russian invasion of Ukraine [/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
   * Kyiv strikes [/wiki/Kyiv_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
     * A Russian [/wiki/Russia] airstrike [/wiki/Airstrike] in Darnytskyi
       District [/wiki/Darnytskyi_District], Kyiv [/wiki/Kyiv], Ukraine
       [/wiki/Ukraine], kills one person and injures three others. (CTV News)
       [https://www.ctvnews.ca/world/russia-ukraine-war/article/1-killed-in-russian-attack-on-kyiv-as-death-toll-from-earlier-missile-strike-rises-to-19/]
   * Kryvyi Rih strikes [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
     * The death toll from Friday's missile [/wiki/Missile] strike on Kryvyi Rih
       [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih], Ukraine, rises to 20 deaths, including children, and
       75 injuries. (CTV News)
       [https://www.ctvnews.ca/world/russia-ukraine-war/article/1-killed-in-russian-attack-on-kyiv-as-death-toll-from-earlier-missile-strike-rises-to-19/]
   * Northern front of the Russian invasion of Ukraine
     [/wiki/Northern_front_of_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
     * Russian troops [/wiki/Russian_Ground_Forces] reportedly capture the
       village of Basivka [/wiki/Basivka,_Sumy_Oblast] in Ukraine's Sumy Oblast
       [/wiki/Sumy_Oblast]. (Reuters)
       [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-says-it-gains-control-over-village-ukraines-sumy-region-2025-04-06/]
 * Gaza war [/wiki/Gaza_war]
   * Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip
     [/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip]
     * At least 46 people are killed in Israeli [/wiki/Israel] strikes on the
       Gaza Strip [/wiki/Gaza_Strip] over the last 24 hours. (Al Jazeera)
       [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2025/4/6/live-israel-kills-30-in-gaza-outrage-grows-over-killings-of-15-medics]
 * Red Sea crisis [/wiki/Red_Sea_crisis]
   * March–April 2025 United States attacks in Yemen
     [/wiki/March%E2%80%93April_2025_United_States_attacks_in_Yemen]
     * Between two and 70 people are killed and at least nine others are injured
       in overnight U.S. airstrikes targeting Houthi [/wiki/Houthi] forces in
       Saada [/wiki/Saada], Yemen [/wiki/Yemen]. (CTV News)
       [https://www.ctvnews.ca/world/article/yemen-houthi-rebels-say-us-strikes-kill-2-trumps-bombing-video-suggests-higher-overall-death-toll/]
 * Somali Civil War [/wiki/Somali_Civil_War_(2009%E2%80%93present)]
   * 2025 Shabelle offensive [/wiki/2025_Shabelle_offensive]
     * At least eight civilians are injured after Al-Shabaab militants
       [/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)] launch mortar shells
       [/wiki/Mortar_shells] for the second consecutive day targeting Aden Adde
       International Airport [/wiki/Aden_Adde_International_Airport] and the
       heavily fortified Halane compound in Mogadishu [/wiki/Mogadishu].
       Following the attack, Turkish Airlines [/wiki/Turkish_Airlines] and
       Egyptair [/wiki/Egyptair] cancel scheduled flights. (Garowe Online)
       [https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/somalia/mortar-attack-near-somalia-presidential-palace-wounds-at-least-six]
       (Hiiraan Online)
       [https://www.hiiraan.com/news4/2025/Apr/201005/mortar_shells_strike_near_halane_compound_and_aden_adde_airport_in_mogadishu.aspx]
       (Garowe Online)
       [https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/somalia/mogadishu-airport-halane-camp-targeted-in-al-shabaab-mortar-attacks]

Health and environment

 * 2025 Southwest United States measles outbreak
   [/wiki/2025_Southwest_United_States_measles_outbreak]
   * A child dies from measles [/wiki/Measles] complications at the UMC Health
     System in Lubbock [/wiki/Lubbock], Texas [/wiki/Texas], United States,
     becoming the third measles-related death amid outbreaks and the second
     unvaccinated child victim. (CTV News)
     [https://www.ctvnews.ca/world/article/us-sees-third-measles-related-death-amid-outbreaks/]

Disasters and accidents

 * Tornado outbreak and floods of April 2–6, 2025
   [/wiki/Tornado_outbreak_and_floods_of_April_2%E2%80%936,_2025]
   * The death toll from the severe weather
     [/wiki/Tornado_outbreak_and_floods_of_April_2%E2%80%936,_2025] in the
     United States [/wiki/United_States] rises to 18. (ABC News)
     [https://abcnews.go.com/amp/US/significant-severe-weather-flash-flooding-continue-impacting-south/story?id=120519101]
   * Kentucky Governor [/wiki/Governor_of_Kentucky] Andy Beshear
     [/wiki/Andy_Beshear] says that two people have died and 500 roads are
     closed in the state [/wiki/Kentucky] due to flooding. (Reuters)
     [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/kentucky-says-2-dead-after-floods-over-dozen-killed-recently-other-us-parts-2025-04-06/]
 * 2025 South Korea wildfires [/wiki/2025_South_Korea_wildfires]
   * The death toll from the South Korea wildfires rises to 32 after a Bell 206
     [/wiki/Bell_206] firefighting helicopter crashed during operations to
     combat a wildfire in Daegu [/wiki/Daegu], South Korea [/wiki/South_Korea],
     killing the pilot. (Korea JoongAng Daily)
     [https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-04-06/national/socialAffairs/Pilot-killed-after-firefighting-helicopter-crashes-in-Daegu/2278818]
 * Around thirty people are killed from overnight heavy flooding [/wiki/Flood]
   caused by torrential rains and water overflowing from the banks of the Ndjili
   River [/wiki/Ndjili_River] in Kinshasa [/wiki/Kinshasa], Democratic Republic
   of Congo [/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_Congo]. (Al Jazeera)
   [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/4/6/heavy-floods-in-dr-congos-kinshasa-leave-dozens-dead-destroy-homes]
 * An air ambulance [/wiki/Air_ambulance] helicopter crashes in the Tsushima
   Strait [/wiki/Tsushima_Strait] off the coast of Nagasaki Prefecture
   [/wiki/Nagasaki_Prefecture] in southwestern Japan [/wiki/Japan], killing
   three of the six occupants onboard. (AP)
   [https://apnews.com/article/japan-ambulance-helicopter-crash-rescue-missing-6cd908d6fb7d77dfdd22789c6aa3d4ba]
   (NHK) [https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20250406/k10014771751000.html]

Law and crime

 * Four children are injured in a mass stabbing [/wiki/Mass_stabbing] inside a
   house in Bensonhurst [/wiki/Bensonhurst,_Brooklyn], Brooklyn
   [/wiki/Brooklyn], New York [/wiki/New_York_(state)], United States. The
   perpetrator was shot and critically injured by responding officers. (NBC
   News)
   [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/brooklyn-meat-cleaver-attack-rcna199907]

Politics and elections

 * 2025 French far-right protests [/wiki/2025_French_far-right_protests]
   * National Rally [/wiki/National_Rally] organizes a large demonstration in
     central Paris [/wiki/Paris] to protest Marine Le Pen
     [/wiki/Marine_Le_Pen]'s conviction in the National Front assistants affair
     [/wiki/National_Front_assistants_affair] rendering her ineligible to run in
     the 2027 French presidential election
     [/wiki/2027_French_presidential_election]. (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/france-le-pen-demonstration-embezzlement-20517c4a97e35c9fa0a658960365bed9]

Sports

 * 2024–25 NHL season [/wiki/2024%E2%80%9325_NHL_season]
   * In ice hockey [/wiki/Ice_hockey], Washington Capitals
     [/wiki/Washington_Capitals] forward Alexander Ovechkin
     [/wiki/Alexander_Ovechkin] scores his 895th career goal, surpassing the
     all-time goals record [/wiki/List_of_NHL_players_with_500_goals] held by
     Wayne Gretzky [/wiki/Wayne_Gretzky]. (Reuters)
     [https://www.reuters.com/sports/nhl/ovechkin-breaks-gretzky-nhls-all-time-goals-record-with-895th-2025-04-06/]

April 5, 2025 (2025-04-5) (Saturday)

Armed conflicts and attacks

 * Russian invasion of Ukraine [/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
   * Kryvyi Rih strikes [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
     * The Ukrainian government [/wiki/Government_of_Ukraine] declares April 6
       as a day of mourning [/wiki/National_day_of_mourning] following
       yesterday's Russian [/wiki/Russian_Armed_Forces] missile strike on Kryvyi
       Rih [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih] in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast
       [/wiki/Dnipropetrovsk_Oblast], Ukraine [/wiki/Ukraine], that killed
       twenty people, one of the deadliest strikes
       [/wiki/Attacks_on_civilians_in_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine] since the
       start of the invasion. (de Volkskrant)
       [https://www.volkskrant.nl/buitenland/een-van-de-dodelijkste-russische-aanvallen-ver-van-de-frontlinie-dompelt-kryvy-rih-in-rouw~baba6afe/]
 * Somali Civil War [/wiki/Somali_Civil_War_(2009%E2%80%93present)]
   * 2025 Shabelle offensive [/wiki/2025_Shabelle_offensive]
     * Colonel Nur Farey, the senior Somali military [/wiki/Somali_Armed_Forces]
       commander of the 14th brigade, is assassinated by a man believed to be an
       al-Shabaab [/wiki/Al-Shabaab_(militant_group)] militant in Addow Dibille
       near Afgoye [/wiki/Afgoye], Lower Shabelle [/wiki/Lower_Shabelle],
       Somalia [/wiki/Somalia]. (Hiiraan Online)
       [https://www.hiiraan.com/news4/2025/Apr/200987/senior_somali_army_commander_killed_during_troop_visit_in_lower_shabelle_region.aspx]

Business and economy

 * Tariffs in the second Trump administration
   [/wiki/Tariffs_in_the_second_Trump_administration], Executive orders in the
   second presidency of Donald Trump
   [/wiki/List_of_executive_orders_in_the_second_presidency_of_Donald_Trump]
   * Executive Order 14257 [/wiki/Donald_Trump%27s_Liberation_Day_speech]
     * The first of two tariff [/wiki/Tariff] rounds go into effect in the
       United States [/wiki/United_States], containing a 10% blanket tariff on
       every import into the country. The second round of country-specific
       tariffs [/wiki/Liberation_Day_tariffs] is scheduled to go into effect on
       April 9. (Reuters)
       [https://www.reuters.com/markets/us-starts-collecting-trumps-new-10-tariff-smashing-global-trade-norms-2025-04-05/]

Disasters and accidents

 * Two people are killed after a caravan [/wiki/Caravan_(trailer)] catches fire
   at a campsite [/wiki/Campsite] in Skegness [/wiki/Skegness], Lincolnshire
   [/wiki/Lincolnshire], England [/wiki/England]. (Sky News)
   [https://news.sky.com/story/two-people-die-after-caravan-fire-at-holiday-park-in-lincolnshire-13342390]
 * Two people are killed after a metal structure collapses during the Festival
   Ceremonia [/wiki/Festival_Ceremonia] in Mexico City [/wiki/Mexico_City],
   Mexico [/wiki/Mexico]. (USA Today)
   [https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2025/04/06/axe-ceremonia-2025-canceled-deaths-collapse/82966063007/]

International relations

 * Israel–United Kingdom relations
   [/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93United_Kingdom_relations]
   * Israel [/wiki/Israel] blocks two British [/wiki/United_Kingdom] Labour
     Party [/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)] MPs
     [/wiki/Member_of_Parliament_(United_Kingdom)] from entering the country.
     (Reuters)
     [https://www.reuters.com/world/two-british-mps-detained-by-israel-british-foreign-minister-says-2025-04-05/]
 * South Sudan–United States relations
   [/wiki/South_Sudan%E2%80%93United_States_relations], Immigration policy of
   the second Donald Trump administration
   [/wiki/Immigration_policy_of_the_second_Donald_Trump_administration]
   * U.S. Secretary of State [/wiki/U.S._Secretary_of_State] Marco Rubio
     [/wiki/Marco_Rubio] announces the revocation of all visas
     [/wiki/Travel_visa] of South Sudanese [/wiki/South_Sudan] passport holders,
     citing "the failure of South Sudan's transitional government
     [/wiki/Transitional_government] to accept the return of its repatriated
     citizens in a timely manner." (BBC)
     [https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cn5x775plnlo]

Politics and elections

 * Protests against the second presidency of Donald Trump
   [/wiki/Protests_against_the_second_presidency_of_Donald_Trump]
   * "Hands Off" protests [/wiki/Hands_Off_protests] against President Donald
     Trump [/wiki/Donald_Trump] occur across the United States. (The New York
     Times)
     [https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/05/us/politics/anti-trump-protests-hands-off.html]

Sports

 * 2025 Grand National [/wiki/2025_Grand_National]
   * In horse racing [/wiki/Horse_racing], Nick Rockett [/wiki/Nick_Rockett],
     rode by Irish jockey Patrick Mullins [/wiki/Patrick_Mullins_(jockey)], wins
     the 2025 Grand National [/wiki/Grand_National] at Aintree Racecourse
     [/wiki/Aintree_Racecourse] in England [/wiki/England]. (BBC Sport)
     [https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/horse-racing/articles/cgm89zye9dwo]

Armed conflicts and attacks

 * Russo-Ukrainian War [/wiki/Russo-Ukrainian_War]
   * Russian invasion of Ukraine [/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
     * Kharkiv strikes [/wiki/Kharkiv_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
       * Five people are killed
         [/wiki/Attacks_on_civilians_in_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine],
         including a child, and 35 are injured in a Russian
         [/wiki/Russian_Armed_Forces] drone attack [/wiki/Drone_warfare] on a
         residential area in Novobavarskyi District
         [/wiki/Novobavarskyi_District] of Kharkiv [/wiki/Kharkiv], Ukraine
         [/wiki/Ukraine]. (Ukrainska Pravda)
         [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2025/04/4/7506067/]
     * Kryvyi Rih strikes [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
       * A Russian ballistic missile [/wiki/Ballistic_missile] strike on a
         residential area in Kryvyi Rih [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih], Ukraine
         [/wiki/Ukraine], kills 19 people, including nine children, and injures
         more than 50 others. The Russian Defence Ministry
         [/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Russia)] says its forces were targeting a
         military gathering in the city. (CNN)
         [https://edition.cnn.com/2025/04/04/americas/ukraine-strike-zelensky-russia-latam-intl/index.html]
         (BBC News) [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c3wxe5g4z9yo]
         (Ukrainska Pravda)
         [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2025/04/4/7506089/] (Reuters)
         [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-missile-hits-residential-area-ukraines-kryvyi-rih-kills-12-2025-04-04/]
 * M23 campaign [/wiki/M23_campaign_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
   * 2025 Walikale offensive [/wiki/2025_Walikale_offensive]
     * The Congolese [/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo] media reports that
       M23 [/wiki/March_23_Movement] rebels retreating from Walikale
       [/wiki/Walikale] have arrived in Kibua [/wiki/Kibua] in North Kivu
       [/wiki/North_Kivu], Democratic Republic of the Congo. (Critical Threats)
       [https://www.criticalthreats.org/briefs/congo-war-security-review/congo-war-security-review-april-4-2025]
 * Syrian civil war [/wiki/Syrian_civil_war]
   * Syrian peace process [/wiki/Syrian_peace_process]
     * Groups of Kurdish [/wiki/Kurds_in_Syria]-led Syrian Democratic Forces
       [/wiki/Syrian_Democratic_Forces] (SDF) militants withdraw from the two
       neighborhoods of Sheikh Maqsood [/wiki/Sheikh_Maqsood] and Achrafieh in
       Aleppo [/wiki/Aleppo], Syria [/wiki/Syria], as part of a deal with the
       Syrian government [/wiki/Syrian_government], which will eventually merge
       the SDF and the Syrian Armed Forces [/wiki/Syrian_Armed_Forces] under one
       command. (AP)
       [https://apnews.com/article/syria-aleppo-sdf-sheikh-maksoud-achrafieh-withdrawal-9b8cd819c04b222a695455bb426f92df]
 * Gaza war [/wiki/Gaza_war]
   * More than 30 people are killed in Israeli [/wiki/Israel] airstrikes in Gaza
     [/wiki/Gaza_Strip]. (Channel 4 News)
     [https://www.channel4.com/news/gaza-more-than-30-people-killed-in-israeli-strikes]

Business and economy

 * Tariffs in the second Trump administration
   [/wiki/Tariffs_in_the_second_Trump_administration]
   * China–United States trade war [/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war]
     * China [/wiki/China] responds to U.S. President
       [/wiki/President_of_the_United_States] Donald Trump
       [/wiki/Donald_Trump]'s tariffs [/wiki/Tariff] with a 34% reciprocal
       tariff on imports of American [/wiki/United_States] goods. The tariffs
       will take effect on April 10. (CNN)
       [https://edition.cnn.com/2025/04/04/business/china-us-tariffs-retaliation-hnk-intl/index.html]
   * Donald Trump's Liberation Day speech
     [/wiki/Donald_Trump%27s_Liberation_Day_speech]
     * Multiple companies, including Klarna [/wiki/Klarna], StubHub
       [/wiki/StubHub], Nintendo [/wiki/Nintendo], and Professional Sports
       Authenticator [/wiki/Professional_Sports_Authenticator], pause
       price-sensitive business actions in the U.S. to evaluate the impact of
       the recent tariff announcements. (The Wall Street Journal)
       [https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/stock-market-tariffs-trade-war-04-04-2025/card/exclusive-klarna-pauses-planned-ipo-after-trump-tariff-turmoil-NMXYuKXzW6Xv4ao3CSxr]
       (IGN)
       [https://www.ign.com/articles/nintendo-delays-switch-2-pre-order-date-in-the-us-to-assess-impact-of-trumps-tariffs]
       (The Verge)
       [https://www.theverge.com/news/643117/psa-pausing-submissions-outside-us-tariffs]
     * Stocks fall for the second consecutive day following Trump's recent
       tariff announcements. Over the past two days, the S&P 500
       [/wiki/S%26P_500] is down over 10%, while the FTSE 100 [/wiki/FTSE_100]
       is down 6.97% for the week. (The Guardian)
       [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/apr/04/us-business-stock-markets-nyse-blog-trump-tariffs-asian-markets]
 * Democratic Republic of the Congo–United States relations
   [/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo%E2%80%93United_States_relations]
   * Lamuka [/wiki/Lamuka] opposition coalition spokesperson Prince Epenge
     criticizes the proposed minerals-for-security deal between the Democratic
     Republic of Congo [/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_Congo] and the United
     States [/wiki/United_States], describing it as a "sell-off." (Critical
     Threats)
     [https://www.criticalthreats.org/briefs/congo-war-security-review/congo-war-security-review-april-4-2025]

Disasters and accidents

 * Kočani nightclub fire [/wiki/Ko%C4%8Dani_nightclub_fire]
   * The death toll from the fire at a nightclub [/wiki/Nightclub] in Kočani
     [/wiki/Ko%C4%8Dani], North Macedonia [/wiki/North_Macedonia], in March
     increases to 60 as a burn [/wiki/Burn] victim dies in the hospital. (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-nightclub-fire-kocani-lithuania-4ce73965f3b04957fd776e7151defdca]
 * Ten people are killed when a landslide [/wiki/Landslide] caused by torrential
   rains buries two vehicles in Mojokerto [/wiki/Mojokerto], East Java
   [/wiki/East_Java], Indonesia [/wiki/Indonesia]. (AP)
   [https://apnews.com/article/indonesia-landslide-java-eaf21c91d282c7618dde1cd44e67de33]

Law and crime

 * Impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol [/wiki/Impeachment_of_Yoon_Suk_Yeol]
   * The Constitutional Court of Korea [/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Korea]
     unanimously upholds former President [/wiki/President_of_South_Korea] Yoon
     Suk Yeol [/wiki/Yoon_Suk_Yeol]'s impeachment [/wiki/Impeachment] in an 8–0
     vote, removing him from office. (The Korea Times)
     [https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/southkorea/politics/20250404/s-koreas-president-yoon-suk-yeol-impeached]

Politics and elections

 * Deportation of Kilmar Abrego Garcia
   [/wiki/Deportation_of_Kilmar_Abrego_Garcia]
   * United States federal judge [/wiki/United_States_federal_judge] for the
     District Court of Maryland
     [/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_District_of_Maryland] Paula
     Xinis [/wiki/Paula_Xinis] orders the Trump administration
     [/wiki/Second_Trump_administration] to return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a
     Salvadoran [/wiki/El_Salvador] national from Maryland [/wiki/Maryland] who
     was mistakenly deported [/wiki/Deportation] and sent to the Terrorism
     Confinement Center [/wiki/Terrorism_Confinement_Center] in Tecoluca
     [/wiki/Tecoluca], El Salvador. (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/el-salvador-deportation-maryland-man-trump-617bfac0e54b241fa2f54783bdf08628]
 * Thousands of people demonstrate in Bangui [/wiki/Bangui], Central African
   Republic [/wiki/Central_African_Republic], to protest against President
   [/wiki/President_of_the_Central_African_Republic] Faustin-Archange Touadéra
   [/wiki/Faustin-Archange_Touad%C3%A9ra]'s plans to run for a third term with
   the backing of the Russian [/wiki/Russia]-led Wagner Group
   [/wiki/Wagner_Group], who has killed indiscriminately in the country. (AP)
   [https://apnews.com/article/central-african-republic-russia-wagner-d955ae10660d8dc5efdb258dd067be13]

Sports

 * 2024–25 NHL season [/wiki/2024%E2%80%9325_NHL_season]
   * In ice hockey [/wiki/Ice_hockey], Washington Capitals
     [/wiki/Washington_Capitals] forward Alexander Ovechkin
     [/wiki/Alexander_Ovechkin] scores his 894th career goal, tying the all-time
     goals record [/wiki/List_of_NHL_players_with_500_goals] held by Wayne
     Gretzky [/wiki/Wayne_Gretzky]. (ESPN)
     [https://www.espn.com/nhl/story/_/id/44537592/capitals-alex-ovechkin-ties-wayne-gretzky-894th-goal]

April 3, 2025 (2025-04-3) (Thursday)
 * edit
   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_3&action=edit&editintro=Portal:Current_events/Edit_instructions]
 * history
   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_3&action=history]
 * watch
   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_3&action=watch]

Armed conflicts and attacks

 * Gaza war [/wiki/Gaza_war]
   * Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip
     [/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip]
     * Rafah offensive [/wiki/Rafah_offensive]
       * The Israel Defense Forces [/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces] retakes control
         of Rafah [/wiki/Rafah], prompting thousands of Palestinians
         [/wiki/Palestinians] to flee the city. (Reuters)
         [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/hundreds-thousands-flee-israel-seizes-rafah-new-gaza-security-zone-2025-04-03/]
       * At least 100 Palestinians [/wiki/Palestinians] are killed and 70 others
         are injured, including some critically, in airstrikes [/wiki/Airstrike]
         across the Gaza Strip [/wiki/Gaza_Strip]. One of the strikes killed at
         least 27 people, including 8 men, 14 women, and 5 children, at a
         sheltering school in the north. (AP News)
         [https://apnews.com/article/israel-gaza-hamas-strike-casualties-76c88384839a9ac71c87f0045278c385]
 * M23 campaign [/wiki/M23_campaign_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
   * 2025 Walikale offensive [/wiki/2025_Walikale_offensive]
     * M23 [/wiki/March_23_Movement] spokesperson Lawrence Kanyuka claims that
       the group's withdrawal from Walikale [/wiki/Walikale], North Kivu
       Province [/wiki/North_Kivu_Province], Democratic Republic of the Congo
       [/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo], was to show goodwill for peace
       negotiations [/wiki/Peace_negotiations]. (Critical Threats)
       [https://www.criticalthreats.org/briefs/congo-war-security-review/congo-war-security-review-april-3-2025#_edn5a8850a81da37df564dcd4df35bbe9211]
 * Mexican drug war [/wiki/Mexican_drug_war]
   * At least five CJNG [/wiki/Jalisco_New_Generation_Cartel] gunmen are killed
     and 116 explosive devices seized after a combined operation that took place
     in Apatzingán [/wiki/Apatzing%C3%A1n]. In the same day, in the municipality
     of Parácuaro [/wiki/Par%C3%A1cuaro], an encounter between delinquents, the
     SEDENA [/wiki/Secretariat_of_National_Defense] and the National Guard
     [/wiki/National_Guard_(Mexico)] leaves one gunman killed. (La Jornada)
     [https://www.jornada.com.mx/noticia/2025/04/03/estados/abate-el-ejercito-a-cinco-pistoleros-en-apatzingan]
     (Contramuro)
     [https://www.contramuro.com/gatillero-abatido-enfrentamiento-paracuaro/]
 * A dispute between two groups of miners [/wiki/Miner] over access to gold
   deposits [/wiki/Gold] in La Paz Department
   [/wiki/La_Paz_Department_(Bolivia)], Bolivia [/wiki/Bolivia], escalates into
   clashes with six people reportedly killed and several others missing.
   (Reuters)
   [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/bolivia-wildcat-mining-clash-sees-explosions-six-reported-dead-2025-04-03/]

Business and economy

 * Tariffs in the second Trump administration
   [/wiki/Tariffs_in_the_second_Trump_administration]
   * A 25% tariff [/wiki/Tariff] on all automotive [/wiki/Automotive_industry]
     imports into the United States [/wiki/United_States] enters force. No
     exemptions are announced despite requests from several major trade partners
     [/wiki/List_of_countries_by_leading_trade_partners], including Japan
     [/wiki/Japan] and the United Kingdom [/wiki/United_Kingdom]. (Reuters)
     [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/trump-25-automobile-tariffs-due-take-effect-1201-am-et-april-3-federal-register-2025-04-02/]
   * Multinational [/wiki/Multinational_corporation] car manufacturer
     [/wiki/Automotive_industry] Stellantis [/wiki/Stellantis] announces it will
     lay off [/wiki/Layoff] 900 workers across five of its U.S. factories and
     will pause production at assembly plants in Canada [/wiki/Canada] and
     Mexico [/wiki/Mexico] in response to the tariffs. (Reuters)
     [https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/stellantis-says-will-temporarily-lay-off-900-us-workers-following-tariff-2025-04-03/]

Disasters and accidents

 * January 2025 Southern California wildfires
   [/wiki/January_2025_Southern_California_wildfires]
   * The death toll from wildfires [/wiki/Wildfire] in Southern California
     [/wiki/Southern_California], U.S., increases to 30. (CTV News)
     [https://www.ctvnews.ca/world/article/death-toll-from-the-wildfires-that-tore-through-the-los-angeles-area-reaches-30/]
 * Mediterranean Sea migrant smuggling
   [/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea_migrant_smuggling]
   * Two boats carrying migrants [/wiki/Illegal_immigration] capsize in the
     early hours of the morning near Lesbos [/wiki/Lesbos] in the Aegean Sea
     [/wiki/Aegean_Sea], killing 16 people and leaving one more missing. More
     than 40 people are rescued by the Hellenic Coast Guard
     [/wiki/Hellenic_Coast_Guard]. (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/migration-greece-capsize-lesbos-f8b58302de27e3a819b0bad02b32b28f]
 * Tornado outbreak of April 1–3, 2025
   [/wiki/Tornado_outbreak_of_April_1%E2%80%933,_2025]
   * At least seven people are killed and thirteen others are injured by
     overnight severe weather including tornadoes [/wiki/Tornado], storms
     [/wiki/Storm], hail [/wiki/Hail] and floods [/wiki/Flood] across Tennessee
     [/wiki/Tennessee], Missouri [/wiki/Missouri], and Indiana [/wiki/Indiana]
     in the United States [/wiki/United_States]. (NBC News)
     [https://www.nbcnews.com/weather/floods/live-blog/severe-weather-live-updates-life-threatening-catastrophic-flash-floodi-rcna199446]

International relations

 * Hungary–Israel relations [/wiki/Hungary%E2%80%93Israel_relations]
   * Israeli Prime Minister [/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel] Benjamin Netanyahu
     [/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu] lands in Budapest, Hungary [/wiki/Budapest], a
     signatory of the International Criminal Court
     [/wiki/International_Criminal_Court] (ICC), for a state visit in defiance
     of the international arrest warrant
     [/wiki/International_Criminal_Court_arrest_warrants_for_Israeli_leaders]
     against him for alleged war crimes [/wiki/War_crime]. (The Jerusalem Post)
     [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-848634] (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/netanyahu-visits-hungary-despite-international-arrest-warrant-d3ce4f986adbff6c324b8ef86261731e]
   * The Hungarian government [/wiki/Government_of_Hungary] announces it will
     withdraw from the ICC. (Reuters)
     [https://www.reuters.com/world/hungary-says-it-is-withdrawing-icc-israeli-leader-visits-2025-04-03/]
 * China [/wiki/China] arrests three Filipinos [/wiki/Filipinos] suspected of
   espionage near Chinese military facilities as part of a network recruited by
   Philippine intelligence to gather sensitive information. The Philippines say
   the arrests are related to previous arrests
   [/wiki/2025_China%E2%80%93Philippine_espionage_cases] of Chinese nationals
   for similar offences. (AFP via CNA)
   [https://www.channelnewsasia.com/east-asia/china-arrests-filipinos-suspected-spying-5041696]
   (Reuters)
   [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippines-alarmed-over-china-arrest-alleged-filipino-spies-2025-04-05/]

Law and crime

 * 2025 Turkish protests [/wiki/2025_Turkish_protests]
   * Turkish National Police [/wiki/General_Directorate_of_Security_(Turkey)]
     detain eleven people for spreading calls for and participating in shopping
     boycotts [/wiki/Boycott] in the country [/wiki/Turkey] as a protest against
     the arrest [/wiki/Arrest_of_Ekrem_%C4%B0mamo%C4%9Flu] of Istanbul
     [/wiki/Istanbul] mayor [/wiki/Mayor_of_Istanbul] and opposition
     presidential candidate [/wiki/Next_Turkish_presidential_election] Ekrem
     İmamoğlu [/wiki/Ekrem_%C4%B0mamo%C4%9Flu]. (DW)
     [https://www.dw.com/en/turkey-detains-11-people-for-pro-government-business-boycott-calls/a-72124660]
 * Canada convoy protests [/wiki/Canada_convoy_protests]
   * The Ontario Court of Justice [/wiki/Ontario_Court_of_Justice] in Ontario
     [/wiki/Ontario], Canada [/wiki/Canada], convicts Tamara Lich
     [/wiki/Tamara_Lich] and Chris Barber [/wiki/Christopher_John_Barber], two
     leaders of the truck driver [/wiki/Truck_driver] protest movement against
     COVID-19 vaccination in Canada [/wiki/COVID-19_vaccination_in_Canada], of
     criminal mischief [/wiki/Mischief]. (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/canada-trucker-protests-organizers-guilty-a45b9c16148a1453f290b86350fea795]
 * Mass shootings in the United States
   [/wiki/Mass_shootings_in_the_United_States]
   * Three people, including the perpetrator, are killed and two others are
     injured in a mass shooting [/wiki/Mass_shooting] when a 29-year-old man
     shoots his mother and at passing cars in Sabattus [/wiki/Sabattus,_Maine],
     Maine [/wiki/Maine], United States. (ABC News)
     [https://www.wmtw.com/article/sabattus-maine-deadly-shooting-man-kills-mother-passerby/64378039]
 * Seven people, including the perpetrator, are injured in a mass stabbing
   [/wiki/Mass_stabbing] near Gallaudet University [/wiki/Gallaudet_University]
   in Washington, D.C. [/wiki/Washington,_D.C.], United States. A suspect was
   arrested. (The Independent)
   [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/crime/washington-dc-stabbing-injuries-b2727099.html]
 * A 50-year-old man sets himself on fire [/wiki/Self-immolation] inside of his
   car in a failed car bombing [/wiki/Car_bomb] near the National Monument
   [/wiki/National_Monument_(Amsterdam)] on Dam Square [/wiki/Dam_Square] in
   Amsterdam [/wiki/Amsterdam], Netherlands [/wiki/Netherlands], causing a small
   explosion and injuring himself. No bystanders were injured. (NDTV)
   [https://www.ndtv.com/world-news/video-moment-car-exploded-in-iconic-amsterdam-square-8079954]

April 2, 2025 (2025-04-2) (Wednesday)
 * edit
   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_2&action=edit&editintro=Portal:Current_events/Edit_instructions]
 * history
   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_2&action=history]
 * watch
   [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Portal:Current_events/2025_April_2&action=watch]

Armed conflicts and attacks

 * Russo-Ukrainian War [/wiki/Russo-Ukrainian_War]
   * Russian invasion of Ukraine [/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
     * Kharkiv strikes [/wiki/Kharkiv_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
       * Russian forces [/wiki/Russian_Armed_Forces] target Kharkiv
         [/wiki/Kharkiv] with at least 13 Geran-2 [/wiki/HESA_Shahed_136] drones
         [/wiki/Drone_warfare], causing fires in industrial and residential
         areas and injuring eight people, including a child. (Ukrainska Pravda)
         [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2025/04/2/7505613/]
     * Kryvyi Rih strikes [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih_strikes_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
       * A Russian missile [/wiki/Missile] strike on an industrial park
         [/wiki/Industrial_park] in Kryvyi Rih [/wiki/Kryvyi_Rih], Ukraine
         [/wiki/Ukraine], kills at least four people and injures 14 others.
         (Reuters)
         [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/zelenskiy-urges-pressure-moscow-russian-missile-kills-four-kryvyi-rih-2025-04-02/]
 * Sudanese civil war [/wiki/Sudanese_civil_war_(2023%E2%80%93present)]
   * Siege of El Fasher [/wiki/Siege_of_El_Fasher]
     * At least two civilians [/wiki/Civilian] are killed in the artillery
       [/wiki/Artillery] shelling [/wiki/Shell_(projectile)] of a displacement
       camp [/wiki/Internal_displacement] in El Fasher [/wiki/El_Fasher], North
       Darfur [/wiki/North_Darfur], Sudan [/wiki/Sudan], by the Rapid Support
       Forces [/wiki/Rapid_Support_Forces]. (AP)
       [https://apnews.com/article/sudan-displacement-famine-elfasher-military-rapid-support-forces-un-38b47acc8fd199f7d5873423bfb441d3]
 * Middle Eastern crisis [/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present)]
   * Israeli invasion of Syria
     [/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present)]
     * The Israeli Air Force [/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force] launches airstrikes
       [/wiki/Airstrike] in Syria [/wiki/Syria] targeting the remaining
       "military [/wiki/Syrian_Armed_Forces] infrastructure", destroying much of
       Hama Air Base [/wiki/Hama_Air_Base] and Tiyas Air Base
       [/wiki/Tiyas_Air_Base], including all remaining hangars [/wiki/Hangar]
       and radars [/wiki/Radar]. The Barzah scientific research centre
       [/wiki/Barzah_scientific_research_centre] is also reportedly bombed. (The
       Times of Israel)
       [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-confirms-syrian-airstrikes-saying-it-struck-remaining-military-capabilities-at-hama-military-airport-t-4-airbase/]
   * Gaza war [/wiki/Gaza_war]
     * Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip
       [/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip]
       * Israeli [/wiki/Israel] prime minister [/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel]
         Benjamin Netanyahu [/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu] announces the country's
         military [/wiki/Israeli_Defence_Forces] will seize large areas of land
         in the Gaza Strip [/wiki/Gaza_Strip] and establish a new occupation
         zone [/wiki/Military_occupation] called the Morag
         [/wiki/Morag_(Israeli_settlement)] Corridor, potentially stretching
         from Rafah [/wiki/Rafah] to Khan Younis [/wiki/Khan_Younis]. (AP)
         [https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-news-gaza-operation-04-02-2025-6b653fc8fa1e6f0c1a0c8d322bd48ccc]
   * Iran–United States relations [/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations]
     * The United States Air Force [/wiki/United_States_Air_Force] deploys 6
       nuclear-capable B-2 stealth bombers [/wiki/Northrop_B-2_Spirit] to Diego
       Garcia [/wiki/Diego_Garcia], amid rising tensions with Iran over their
       nuclear program [/wiki/Nuclear_program_of_Iran]. (AP)
       [https://apnews.com/article/b2-bombers-us-yemen-houthis-iran-israel-hamas-war-487247ed0d6c8743b21d18740b649d1c]
 * Myanmar civil war [/wiki/Myanmar_civil_war_(2021%E2%80%93present)]
   * The Myanmar government [/wiki/Provisional_Government_of_Myanmar] declares a
     temporary ceasefire [/wiki/Ceasefire] with the National Unity Government
     [/wiki/National_Unity_Government_of_Myanmar]-in-exile and its various
     allied ethnic armed organizations
     [/wiki/List_of_ethnic_armed_organisations_in_Myanmar] to facilitate relief
     efforts [/wiki/Disaster_response] following the MW 7.7 earthquake
     [/wiki/2025_Myanmar_earthquake] in the country several days ago. The
     ceasefire is expected to last until April 22. (DW)
     [https://www.dw.com/en/myanmar-military-declares-truce-to-facilitate-quake-relief/a-72112808]
 * M23 campaign (2022–present) [/wiki/M23_campaign_(2022%E2%80%93present)]
   * 2025 Walikale offensive [/wiki/2025_Walikale_offensive]
     * Wazalendo [/wiki/Wazalendo] militias break through March 23 Movement
       [/wiki/March_23_Movement] (M23) positions in Kampala, DRC and launch an
       attack on the M23 rebels in Walikale [/wiki/Walikale]. (Critical Threats)
       [https://www.criticalthreats.org/briefs/congo-war-security-review/congo-war-security-review-april-2-2025#_edn51510bdfe07cd2d09075a7fc5bffe9171]
 * Mexican drug war [/wiki/Mexican_drug_war]
   * An elder peasant was killed after the blasts of a landmine when was riding
     his motorcycle in a rural road in the community of Puerta de Alambre,
     Apatzingán [/wiki/Apatzing%C3%A1n] municipality, Michoacán
     [/wiki/Michoac%C3%A1n].(Revista Proceso)
     [https://www.proceso.com.mx/nacional/2025/4/2/adulto-mayor-que-viajaba-en-moto-muere-tras-explotar-una-mina-en-apatzingan-348602.html]

Arts and culture

 * Archaeologists with the Vienna Museum [/wiki/Vienna_Museum] announce the
   discovery of a mass grave [/wiki/Mass_grave] in Simmering district
   [/wiki/Simmering_(Vienna)] in Vienna [/wiki/Vienna], Austria [/wiki/Austria],
   of around 150 Ancient Roman [/wiki/Ancient_Roman] soldiers
   [/wiki/Military_of_Ancient_Rome] from the 1st century [/wiki/1st_century] who
   likely died in a battle [/wiki/Campaign_history_of_the_Roman_military]. (DW)
   [https://www.dw.com/en/mass-roman-grave-discovered-outside-vienna/a-72121297]
   (Caledonian Record)
   [https://www.caledonianrecord.com/news/national/vienna-archaeologists-reveal-mass-grave-of-fighters-in-roman-empire-era-battle/article_4fdaa3b2-1a57-58da-96e5-5ac653b20e5d.html]

Business and economy

 * Tariffs in the second Trump administration
   [/wiki/Tariffs_in_the_second_Trump_administration]
   * China–United States trade war
     [/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_trade_war], 2025 United States trade war
     with Canada and Mexico
     [/wiki/2025_United_States_trade_war_with_Canada_and_Mexico]
     * Donald Trump's Liberation Day speech
       [/wiki/Donald_Trump%27s_Liberation_Day_speech]
       * U.S. president [/wiki/President_of_the_United_States] Donald Trump
         [/wiki/Donald_Trump] announces a universal 10% tariff [/wiki/Tariff] on
         most imports into the United States [/wiki/United_States], a 20% tariff
         on goods from the European Union [/wiki/European_Union], and a 34%
         tariff on all imports from China [/wiki/China]. The tariffs will take
         effect from April 5.
       * Exceptions include Canada [/wiki/Canada], Cuba [/wiki/Cuba], Mexico
         [/wiki/Mexico], North Korea [/wiki/North_Korea], and Russia
         [/wiki/Russia]. Canada and Mexico had tariffs placed on them in
         February [/wiki/2025_United_States_trade_war_with_Canada_and_Mexico],
         while Cuba, North Korea, and Russia are under U.S. sanctions
         [/wiki/United_States_government_sanctions]. (BBC News)
         [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/c1dr7vy39eet] (France 24)
         [https://www.france24.com/en/americas/20250402-live-us-stocks-fall-ahead-of-trump-s-liberation-day-tariff-announcement]
         (India Today)
         [https://www.indiatoday.in/business/story/russia-canada-north-korea-and-mexico-among-countries-missing-from-donald-trump-reciprocal-tariff-list-2703234-2025-04-03]
       * In the 10% tariff, the U.S. lists the Australian [/wiki/Australia]
         territory of Heard Island and McDonald Islands
         [/wiki/Heard_Island_and_McDonald_Islands] near Antarctica
         [/wiki/Antarctica], despite the fact that it has no human inhabitants,
         imports or exports. In response to finding these islands in the list,
         Australian prime minister [/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Australia] Anthony
         Albanese [/wiki/Anthony_Albanese] commented that "Nowhere on earth is
         safe" for the tariff. (The Guardian)
         [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/apr/03/donald-trump-tariffs-antarctica-uninhabited-heard-mcdonald-islands]
     * The United States Senate [/wiki/United_States_Senate] votes 51–48 on a
       non-binding resolution [/wiki/Non-binding_resolution] to rebuke and
       reverse tariffs on Canada, with Republicans
       [/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)] Rand Paul [/wiki/Rand_Paul],
       Susan Collins [/wiki/Susan_Collins], Lisa Murkowski
       [/wiki/Lisa_Murkowski], and Mitch McConnell [/wiki/Mitch_McConnell]
       voting for the resolution. (NPR)
       [https://www.npr.org/2025/04/02/nx-s1-5347699/senate-trump-tariffs-canada]

Disasters and accidents

 * Tornado outbreak of April 1–3, 2025
   [/wiki/Tornado_outbreak_of_April_1%E2%80%933,_2025]
   * The Storm Prediction Center [/wiki/Storm_Prediction_Center] in the United
     States [/wiki/United_States] issues a high risk convective outlook
     [/wiki/List_of_Storm_Prediction_Center_high_risk_days] over parts of the
     Mississippi River [/wiki/Mississippi_River] valley, ahead of an expected
     tornado outbreak [/wiki/Tornado_outbreak]. (Storm Prediction Center)
     [https://www.spc.noaa.gov/products/outlook/archive/2025/day1otlk_20250402_1200.html]
     (Nine News)
     [https://www.9news.com/article/news/nation-world/severe-weather-expected-rare-high-risk-designation-most-severe-category/507-7a3a3d5b-64ec-4f39-95a3-e81990820a93]
 * Tropical cyclone naming [/wiki/Tropical_cyclone_naming]
   * The World Meteorological Organization
     [/wiki/World_Meteorological_Organization] retires Beryl
     [/wiki/Hurricane_Beryl], Helene [/wiki/Hurricane_Helene], Milton
     [/wiki/Hurricane_Milton], and John [/wiki/Hurricane_John_(2024)] from their
     rotating list of names for hurricanes for the North Atlantic
     [/wiki/Atlantic_hurricane] and East Pacific [/wiki/Pacific_hurricane]
     basins.(WMO)
     [https://wmo.int/news/media-centre/wmo-hurricane-committee-retires-names-of-beryl-helene-milton-and-john]
 * Five people are killed and at least one other is critically injured when a
   private Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation
   [/wiki/Maharashtra_State_Road_Transport_Corporation] bus collides head-on
   [/wiki/Head-on_collision] with two vehicles on the Khamgaon-Shegaon highway
   in Buldhana [/wiki/Buldhana], Maharashtra [/wiki/Maharashtra], India
   [/wiki/India]. (News18 India)
   [https://www.news18.com/india/five-killed-after-bus-crashes-into-suv-in-maharashtras-buldhana-ws-b-9283566.html]
 * A Russian Air Force [/wiki/Russian_Air_Force] Tupolev Tu-22M
   [/wiki/Tupolev_Tu-22M] strategic bomber [/wiki/Strategic_bomber] crashes due
   to a technical malfunction in Irkutsk Oblast [/wiki/Irkutsk_Oblast], Russia
   [/wiki/Russia], killing one crew member and injuring three others. (Reuters)
   [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-strategic-bomber-crashes-siberia-one-person-dead-agencies-report-2025-04-02/]

Health and environment

 * The Slovak [/wiki/Slovakia] government [/wiki/Government_of_Slovakia]
   approves a plan to cull [/wiki/Culling] 350 brown bears
   [/wiki/Eurasian_brown_bear] after a man was found mauled
   [/wiki/Animal_attack] by a bear on March 30. The government had previously
   culled 144 bears in 2024. (AP)
   [https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-bears-cull-attack-safety-37475360ffcb9eda5f8429971f876e9b]
 * The Polish [/wiki/Poland] government [/wiki/Government_of_Poland] increases
   border controls with Slovakia [/wiki/Slovakia] in response to the outbreak of
   foot-and-mouth disease
   [/wiki/Foot-and-mouth_disease#Hungary_and_Slovakia_(2025)] among Slovakia's
   and Hungary [/wiki/Hungary]'s livestock [/wiki/Livestock]. (TVN24)
   [https://tvn24.pl/biznes/z-kraju/rygorystyczne-kontrole-na-granicach-st8392019]

Law and crime

 * War on drugs in Ecuador [/wiki/War_on_drugs_in_Ecuador]
   * A court in New York City [/wiki/New_York_City] indicts José Adolfo Macías
     Villamar [/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Adolfo_Mac%C3%ADas_Villamar], the leader of the
     organized crime syndicate [/wiki/Organized_crime_syndicate] Los Choneros
     [/wiki/Los_Choneros], on seven counts of drug trafficking
     [/wiki/Drug_trafficking], conspiracy [/wiki/Conspiracy], arms trafficking
     [/wiki/Arms_trafficking], and illegal drug distribution
     [/wiki/Illegal_drug_trade] in the United States [/wiki/United_States].
     Villamar is not currently in U.S. custody. (AP)
     [https://apnews.com/article/ecuador-villamar-los-choneros-cocaine-distribution-2d77f25322ebcf5bfd23d485a5900790]

Sports

 * 2025 CFL season [/wiki/2025_CFL_season]
   * TSN [/wiki/The_Sports_Network] president Stewart Johnston
     [/wiki/Stewart_Johnston] is announced as the 15th commissioner of the
     Canadian Football League [/wiki/Canadian_Football_League], replacing Randy
     Ambrosie [/wiki/Randy_Ambrosie] who had served in the role since 2017.
     (CBC)
     [https://www.cbc.ca/sports/football/cfl/cfl-commissioner-stewart-johnston-april2-1.7499798]

Armed conflicts and attacks

 * Middle Eastern crisis [/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present)]
   * Gaza war [/wiki/Gaza_war]
     * Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip
       [/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip]
       * UNICEF [/wiki/UNICEF] reports that over 332 children have been killed
         and 609 injured by the new Israeli military
         [/wiki/Israeli_Defence_Forces] offensive across the Gaza Strip
         [/wiki/Gaza_Strip] since the resumption of the war after the breakdown
         of the 2025 ceasefire [/wiki/2025_Gaza_war_ceasefire]. (BBC News)
         [https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c0r5827dke1o] (UNICEF)
         [https://www.unicef.org/press-releases/least-322-children-reportedly-killed-gaza-strip-following-breakdown-ceasefire]
   * Israel–Hezbollah conflict
     [/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hezbollah_conflict_(2023%E2%80%93present)]
     * 2024 Israel–Lebanon ceasefire agreement
       [/wiki/2024_Israel%E2%80%93Lebanon_ceasefire_agreement]
       * Four people are killed, including Hassan Bdeir, a high-ranking
         Hezbollah [/wiki/Hezbollah] official, and seven others are injured by
         an Israeli [/wiki/Israel] airstrike [/wiki/Airstrike] on a building in
         Dahieh [/wiki/Dahieh], Beirut [/wiki/Beirut], Lebanon [/wiki/Lebanon].
         (Reuters)
         [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/airplanes-fly-low-over-lebanons-beirut-huge-blasts-heard-reuters-witnesses-say-2025-04-01/]
         (Al Jazeera)
         [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/4/1/israel-bombs-lebanons-beirut-again-testing-fragile-truce-with-hezbollah]
   * Red Sea crisis [/wiki/Red_Sea_crisis]
     * March 2025 United States attacks in Yemen
       [/wiki/March_2025_United_States_attacks_in_Yemen]
       * The Houthis [/wiki/Houthi] claim that they shot down a U.S. military
         [/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces]-operated MQ-9 Reaper
         [/wiki/MQ-9_Reaper] drone [/wiki/Drone_warfare] in Marib Governorate
         [/wiki/Marib_Governorate], Yemen [/wiki/Yemen]. (AP)
         [https://apnews.com/article/yemen-houthis-mq9-shot-down-israel-hamas-war-us-airstrikes-6bd7764ba19e84d2dddac0d3c762459a]
       * U.S. missile strikes on Hodeidah [/wiki/Hodeidah], Yemen, hit a water
         management facility [/wiki/Water_resources], killing at least four
         people, according to the Houthi-run Al-Masirah [/wiki/Al-Masirah]
         network. (Al Jazeera)
         [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/4/2/us-attacks-kill-4-in-yemen-as-second-aircraft-carrier-sent-to-middle-east]
       * The U.S. announces it is sending a second aircraft carrier strike
         group, the USS Carl Vinson [/wiki/USS_Carl_Vinson] group, to the
         region. (Al Jazeera)
         [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/4/2/us-attacks-kill-4-in-yemen-as-second-aircraft-carrier-sent-to-middle-east]
 * Russian invasion of Ukraine [/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
   * Eastern front of the Russian invasion of Ukraine
     [/wiki/Eastern_front_of_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine]
     * The Russian [/wiki/Russia] ministry of defence
       [/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Russia)] says that Russian forces
       [/wiki/Russian_Armed_Forces] have captured Rozlyv
       [/w/index.php?title=Rozlyv&action=edit&redlink=1] [uk
       [https://uk.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A0%D0%BE%D0%B7%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%B2_(%D0%92%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D1%81%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B9%D0%BE%D0%BD)]]
       in Donetsk Oblast [/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast], Ukraine [/wiki/Ukraine]. (Al
       Arabiya)
       [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2025/04/01/russian-army-says-it-captures-village-in-eastern-ukraine]

Disasters and accidents

 * 2023–2025 Sundhnúkur eruptions
   [/wiki/2023%E2%80%932025_Sundhn%C3%BAkur_eruptions]
   * Seismic activity increases near Grindavík [/wiki/Grindav%C3%ADk], Iceland
     [/wiki/Iceland], with the Icelandic Meteorological Office
     [/wiki/Icelandic_Meteorological_Office] reporting that a volcanic eruption
     [/wiki/Volcanic_eruption] has occurred and a earthquake is being
     registered. People visiting the Blue Lagoon
     [/wiki/Blue_Lagoon_(geothermal_spa)] are evacuated rapidly. (The Watchers)
     [https://watchers.news/2025/04/01/volcanic-eruption-reported-near-grindavik-iceland/]
 * 2025 Putra Heights pipeline fire [/wiki/2025_Putra_Heights_pipeline_fire]
   * At least 305 people are injured after a gas pipeline [/wiki/Gas_pipeline]
     owned by Petronas [/wiki/Petronas] explodes and ignites a fire in Putra
     Heights [/wiki/Putra_Heights], Selangor [/wiki/Selangor], Malaysia
     [/wiki/Malaysia]. (Malay Mail)
     [https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2025/04/01/what-we-know-so-far-about-the-puchong-gas-pipeline-inferno/171544]
 * A small airplane crashes into a lake in Os [/wiki/Os,_Hordaland] near Bergen
   [/wiki/Bergen], Norway [/wiki/Norway], killing the two people onboard.
   (Sunnmørsposten)
   [https://www.smp.no/nyheter/i/GybEPJ/soek-etter-savnet-smaafly-i-vann-i-bjoernafjorden-to-personer-om-bord]

International relations

 * Cross-strait relations [/wiki/Cross-strait_relations]
   * The Chinese [/wiki/China] PLA [/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army] Navy
     [/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army_Navy] and Air Force
     [/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army_Air_Force] conduct large-scale military
     exercises [/wiki/Military_exercise] around Taiwan [/wiki/Taiwan]. At least
     19 Chinese warships are deployed, including the aircraft carrier
     [/wiki/Aircraft_carrier] Shandong
     [/wiki/Chinese_aircraft_carrier_Shandong], marking its closest ever
     approach to the island. (The Guardian)
     [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/apr/01/china-launches-surprise-military-drills-around-taiwan]
     (Financial Times)
     [https://www.ft.com/content/49f45301-4f96-4dec-9157-e2558ed0cb74]

Politics and elections

 * Cory Booker's marathon speech [/wiki/Cory_Booker%27s_marathon_speech]
   * U.S. Senator [/wiki/United_States_Senate] Cory Booker [/wiki/Cory_Booker]
     delivers the longest speech in United States Senate
     [/wiki/United_States_Senate] history, breaking the previous record
     [/wiki/Strom_Thurmond_filibuster_of_the_Civil_Rights_Act_of_1957] set by
     Strom Thurmond [/wiki/Strom_Thurmond] in 1957. (AP News)
     [https://apnews.com/live/donald-trump-news-updates-4-1-2025]

Science and technology

 * Private spaceflight [/wiki/Private_spaceflight]
   * SpaceX [/wiki/SpaceX] successfully launches four humans [/wiki/Human] into
     orbit over Earth’s poles [/wiki/Polar_orbit] for the first time for the
     human spaceflight [/wiki/Human_spaceflight] mission Fram2 [/wiki/Fram2].
     The journey will last three to five days. (The New York Times)
     [https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/01/world/asia/spacex-rocket-launch.html]
